chatbot package¶

Submodules¶

chatbot.account module¶

chatbot.account.deposit(user_id: str, account: str, amount: Decimal, description: str = '')¶
chatbot.account.list_accounts(user_id: str) → list[Account]¶

List all of the user’s accoutns.

Parameters:

user_id – The user ID of the account owner.

Returns:

All accounts that are avaialbe for transfering.

chatbot.account.list_transactions(user_id: str, account: str, days: int) → list[Transaction]¶

List all the transactions of the specified account.

Parameters:

  • user_id – The user ID of the owner of the account.

  • account – The number or name of the account.

  • days – How many days in the past that the transactions need to be queried.

Returns:

The transactions that match conditions set by the arguments.

chatbot.account.list_transfer_target_accounts(user_id: str, from_account: str) → list[Account]¶

List all of the user’s accounts that the specified account can transfer to.

Parameters:

  • user_id – The user ID of the account owner.

  • from_account – The account number or account name that the fund will be transfered from.

Returns:

All the accounts that funds can be transfered from the specified account.

chatbot.account.transfer_between_accounts(user_id: str, from_account: str, to_account: str, amount: Decimal, description: str = '')¶

Transfer specific amount of fund from one account to the other of the same owner.

Parameters:

  • user_id – The user ID of the account owner.

  • from_account – The account number or account name that the fund will be transfered from.

  • to_account – The account number or account name that the fund will be transfered to.

chatbot.account.withdraw(user_id: str, account: str, amount: Decimal, description: str = '')¶

chatbot.database module¶

chatbot.database.auth_user(user_id: str, password: str) → bool¶

Ensure the user id and password are match to pair stored in database. This is a just a part of a simple demo, you should never store clear text passwords in production.

Parameters:

  • user_id – The user ID that needing authentcation.

  • password – The matching password to the user ID.

Returns:

True if user ID and password are matched, False otherwise.

chatbot.database.init_db()¶

Create the database and add inital test data.

chatbot.database.load_accounts(user_id: str) → list[Account]¶

Query accounts that belong to the speicfied user.

Parameters:

user_id – The user ID of the account owner

Returns:

All the accounts that belong the the user

chatbot.database.load_transactions(user_id: str, account: str, from_date: date, to_date: date)¶
chatbot.database.load_transfer_target_accounts(user_id: str, from_account: str) → list[Account]¶

Query accounts that the specified account can trasfer fund to.

Parameters:

  • user_id – The user ID of the account owner

  • from_account – The account number or account name that the fund would be transferred from.

Returns:

All the accounts that the specified account can transfer to.

chatbot.database.transfer_fund(user_id: str, from_account: str, to_account: str, amount: Decimal, description: str = '')¶

Deduct fund from one account then add to the other account all under the same owner

Parameters:

  • user_id – The user ID of the account owner

  • from_account – The account number or account name that the fund would be transferred from.

  • to_account – The account number or account name that the fund would be transferred to.

  • amount – The amount that is going to be transfered.

  • description – Optional description of the nature of the transaction.

chatbot.models module¶

class chatbot.models.Account(account_number: str, account_name: str, balance: Decimal, currency_code: str)¶

Bases: object

Represent an account of a user

account_name: str¶

Name of the account.

account_number: str¶

The unique account number.

balance: Decimal¶

The current balance of the account.

currency_code: str¶

The currency of the fund in the account

class chatbot.models.Transaction(transaction_number: int, account_number: str, transaction_type: str, date_time: datetime, amount: Decimal, description: str, balance_after: Decimal)¶

Bases: object

Represent one transaction of an account

account_number: str¶

The account number of transaction being applied to.

amount: Decimal¶

The amount involved in the transaction

balance_after: Decimal¶

The account balance after the transaction

date_time: datetime¶

The date and time the transaction happens.

description: str¶

Additional description of the transaction

transaction_number: int¶

A unique string identifyig the transaction. All records involved in one transaction share a transaction number

transaction_type: str¶

The transaction can be credit or debit.
